N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 595.7 - Functional program

State Regulations
(a) A functional
program shall be developed and submitted with the provider's application for
initial certification. The functional program shall, at a minimum, include: (1)
a description of the program mission, and
the population to be served; (2)
admission and discharge criteria; (3)
a description of the specific service
needs of the defined target population; (4)
a description of the existing service
system, including but not limited to, mental health, health, social and other
support services; (5)
a description
of the residents' utilization or non-utilization of the existing service system
and the rationale for such service use patterns; (6)
a description of the goals and
anticipated outcomes of the program, including the anticipated average length
of stay for residents; (7)
a
description of the provider's role, if any, in providing a crisis bed capacity
within the geographical area; (8)
a
description of the proposed staff pattern, including job descriptions and
qualifications, number of FTE's for each position, the supervisory structure
and a staffing schedule; (9)
a
description of the on-site services which will be provided to the residents, including how these services with further the goals and anticipated outcomes of
the program; (10)
a description of
how the residential program will appropriately utilize community- based
services; (11)
a description of the
expectations, if any, which may be placed upon the resident regarding program
participation within the residence and participation in programs outside the
residence; and
(12)
a description
of the process for providing of information about and explaining the rights of
residents to both staff and residents. (b) The functional program shall serve as a
basis for delineating anticipated program outcomes which shall be monitored
pursuant to section
595.13
of this Part. Notes
